intro: Rhexia mariana var. portoricensis, commonly known as the Puerto Rican flameflower, is a flowering plant native to the island of Puerto Rico. It belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and streamside areas. It has hairy stems and leaves with a slightly serrated edge, and its flowers bloom in late summer to early fall. This variety is considered a rare and endemic species, highlighting its ecological significance in Puerto Rican flora.
